posts.post_content:
@Ferlord: Unless Gatherer and a whole lot of people at Wizards are seriously mistaken, this card was not "in every core set since Alpha." Note that Royal Assassin seems to be missing the 5th, 6th, and 7th edition icons. But even if those were wrong, I doubt during the Core Set Survivor promotion Wizards had prior to M12 that they somehow missed that Royal Assassin should have made the list of contestants. The only card to have been printed in every core set from Alpha to M12 is in fact [Giant Spider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Spider): http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/arcana/718  
  
Your general idea, that Royal Assassin is amazing, remains true, though.
posts.html:
@Ferlord: Unless Gatherer and a whole lot of people at Wizards are seriously mistaken, this card was not "in every core set since Alpha." Note that Royal Assassin seems to be missing the 5th, 6th, and 7th edition icons. But even if those were wrong, I doubt during the Core Set Survivor promotion Wizards had prior to M12 that they somehow missed that Royal Assassin should have made the list of contestants. The only card to have been printed in every core set from Alpha to M12 is in fact Giant Spider: http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/arcana/718

Your general idea, that Royal Assassin is amazing, remains true, though.

Posted By: sarroth (12/3/2011 7:47:03 PM)
Rating:

@Deco_y

I assume you mean Gideon's Lawkeeper rather than Gideon's Avenger; if so, you would be quite right (all 3 cards together would be a nice combo as well). Also, the Crown of Empires would work as well for a mono black deck (although at a higher price). Basically anything that can allow you to tap your opponent's creatures is awesome with this guy (especially to kill those annoying ones with Vigilance).

Definitely one of my favourite cards.

posts.post_content:
Out of all of the reprints (especially for being in every core set since Alpha), Royal Assassin has aged quite well.   
It's not like [Sengir Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sengir Vampire) who grows crotchety and his somehow aging bones has made him only Uncommon at the nursing home.   
No, when the years start to wear on him, he says "F\*\*k you time. If you were tapped, I'd kill you!" while everyone stares in worry as they start to strap him back into the straitjacket and put him back in his room while Sengir starts laughing but also cries a little inside because people don't think the vampire could ACTUALLY kill time.  
Because the Assassin has done it before, and he's not afraid to do it again (Wonder why [Time Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Elemental) hasn't been reprinted? Now you know. And shut up, it isn't because it's ability is almost useless or whatever).  
  
What i am saying is that Royal Assassin is a good card that was made 18 years ago.   
  
and that old assassin's never lose their touch.   
  
PS. No, I'm not crazy. I... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Surprisingly, no one has quoted the words how this card is from:  
  
"To eliminate your enemy, Hit them in their sleep,   
And when all is won and lost, The spoils of wars are yours to keep."   
- , Megadeth  
  
OK I know this quote is much more famous from Ultima V and Lord British (every geek from the 80s know how the whole deal is about, and I bet PhD Garfield do), but this is how the idea of this card came about.
